did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Donald W. Baker College Veterinary Medicine Photograph Collection, 1950- 1969.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Collection of photographs mostly pertaining to the Veterinary School at Cornell showing faculty, staff, facilities, students, classes, events, and other topics documenting operations in the College.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Professor Donald Wyckoff Baker, D.V.M., Ph.D. (1899-1978) was Director of the Diagnostic Laboratory (1928-1933), Assistant Professor (1933) of Parasitology, Associate Professor (1940), Professor (1947), and Professor Emeritus (1965) at the New York State College of Veterinary Medicine. As such, he became the first Professor of Parasitology at the College. Over a span of 37 years, Dr. Baker was "devoted to people, the Veterinary College, and Cornell University" as a frequent traveler, speaker at hundreds of meetings, author of scientific papers, and consulting veterinarian. As a teacher, "he chose to emphasize the problem that parasitism presented to the clinician."

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Collection of photographs mostly pertaining to the Veterinary School at Cornell. The photographs are almost entirely taken by Baker. Some subjects extend beyond the Vet School to other areas of Cornell. The photographs show faculty, staff, facilities, students, classes, events, and other topics documenting operations in the College.
